page.title: 05Homelife in the Felton Area
page.content:
Homelife revolves around the family. The working day is normally eight hours for five days a week. Men and women work on the farms or commute to local towns. Weekends and evenings are leisure time with people visiting public houses, watching television, listening to the radio or visiting the village hall where a number of activities go on to suit all ages. Most people have large gardens and gardening is a popular pastime.
Most people go away once a year on holiday, sometimes to resorts abroad. Cars are used for transport and some people ride motor-cycles or bicycles. Many people own a pet - a dog, cat, bird or even a ferret. Only dogs require a licence, though a farmer's working dog does not require one.
